content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 1.24 - Executive Order No. 24: Relating to the creation of the Health Resources Commission

State Regulations
I, Nelson A. Rockefeller, by virtue of the authority vested
in me by the Constitution and the laws of the State of New York, and as

Governor of the State of New York, by Executive Order do hereby create in the

Department of Health a Health Resources Commission, which body shall provide
the necessary stimulation and coordination of public and private endeavors to
make more effective use of existing health manpower resources and stimulate the
interest of young people in health careers. Such Commission shall have eleven voting members who shall
be the Commissioners of Health, Education, and Mental Hygiene and eight
appointive members, appointed by the Governor, one of whom shall be a
representative of the State University of New York and six of whom shall be
representatives of professional organizations and groups concerned with the
health professions. The Health Commissioner shall serve as Chairman. The terms
of office for the appointive members shall be three years, except that three of
the initial appointments shall be for one year and two shall be for two
years. General Powers. The Commission shall: Coordinate the activities and
programs of interested departments, agencies and professional associations and
groups to increase the number of persons working in the health field; develop a
statewide program to encourage interest in health careers at educational
institutions, both public and private; and formulate a recommended State policy
relating to guidance, counseling and recruitment of students and graduates for
health careers. The Commission shall conduct such studies, research and
investigations as it may deem advisable and necessary and shall inform the
public concerning the State's efforts to increase available health
resources. Signed: Nelson A. Rockefeller

Dated: November 27, 1967
